results.title: Bill
results.creator_credit: Anthony Page, Mel Stuart and Alan Landsburg Productions
results.brief_description: Bill, a 40 year old intellectually disabled man, must learn to survive the harsh realities of New York City or be recommitted to an institution for the rest of his life. He can neither read nor write and his child-like gentleness and innocence make him an easy target for hurt or rejection.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Page, Mel Stuart and Alan Landsburg Productions
results.description: Bill, a 40 year old intellectually disabled man, must learn to survive the harsh realities of New York City or be recommitted to an institution for the rest of his life. results.title: Bioncle: mask of light
results.creator_credit: David Molina, Terry Shakespeare, Sue Shakespeare, Miramax Films and The Lego Group
results.brief_description: CGI animated feature about robot creatures called Bionicles who live by a code of Unity, Duty and Destiny. ‘Chronicle’ finds a hidden mask that is the mask of light - he must take this mask to find his destiny which is to be the 7th Toa. A good versus evil battle evolves as light battles with the dark Master of Shadow in a bid to free the island home of Mata Nui from darkness. Made by the Lego Company and sure to be enjoyed by young purchasers of BionicleTM products. Direction and Art Direction by David Molina and Terry Shakespeare with a screenplay by Henry Gilroy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Molina, Terry Shakespeare, Sue Shakespeare, Miramax Films and The Lego Group

results.title: Train the trainer : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Nine members of the general public in Melbourne tell their stories. These stories resonate deeply with the participants and, ultimately, are an expression of the creator’s identity.

results.title: Bighorn!
results.brief_description: Focuses on problems facing wildlife and wilderness areas in the United States. Gives the history of the Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep and describes its relationship to its environment. This film was made with the assistance of Yellowstone National Park, Glacier National Park and Grand Teton National Park.
results.description: Focuses on problems facing wildlife and wilderness areas in the United States. results.title: The Will to live
results.creator_credit: Val Colbert, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fragile at birth and not meant to live, Val Colbert’s mother went the extra step to keep her alive. This story is dedicated to Colbert’s mum’s tenacity and eternal strength.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Val Colbert, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Uncovering bones
results.creator_credit: Helen Kakakios, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Helen Kakakios started a journey thinking she would do one thing but opened up all sorts of other possibilities and experiences. A story of identity, family and both the joy and pain of a journey home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helen Kakakios, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Luddite's tale
results.creator_credit: Myfanwy Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Myfawny Thompson is perplexed by technology, especially the need to text to communicate. After helping her mother move house, Thomspon starts to realise what a wonderful gift technology can be.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Myfanwy Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Like blood
results.creator_credit: Maya Haviland, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Petul is my older sister’s godfather and I am the first woman from my family to visit his grave.’ Maya Haviland’s return to Mexico after eight years made her realise the sense of distance between family members.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maya Haviland, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: In search of adventure
results.creator_credit: Kirsty McGeoch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After five years of study, Kirsty McGeoch had a law degree and a lifetime of career achievements ahead. Something, however, was telling her not to do it and to follow another path. Ultimately, this story is about honouring what fulfils the spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kirsty McGeoch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: After five years of study, Kirsty McGeoch had a law degree and a lifetime of career achievements ahead. Something, however, was telling her not to do it and to follow another path. Ultimately, this story is about honouring what fulfils the spirit.

results.title: Illustrating absence
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Carland, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a researcher it was natural for Rebecca Carland to be curious and begin the unravelling. She tells of her obsession with illustrator Arthur Bartholomew, a relationship that has continued in his absence and long after the project concluded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rebecca Carland, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
